body_html:
Yes, when input_shapes = 1, 299, 299, 3 is ok.
but my pb is generated by input tensor of (None, None, None, 3),
I hope the input tensor size is variable.
And I can resize input size in java code,
and my output tensor size is fit for (1, 299, 299, 3) input,
but output is reported error.
I made an experiment that mean op, input tensor size is variable, output tensor is fixed, it is ok.
But now my net output size will change with input tensor.
So I think it is perfect that the output is auto fit for input tensor,
And my java code need allocate an enough memory.
Thanks.

body:
Yes, when input_shapes = 1, 299, 299, 3 is ok.
but my pb is generated by input tensor of (None, None, None, 3),
I hope the input tensor size is variable.
And I can resize input size in java code,
and my output tensor size is fit for (1, 299, 299, 3) input,
but output is reported error.
I made an experiment that mean op, input tensor size is variable, output tensor is fixed, it is ok.
But now my net output size will change with input tensor.
So I think it is perfect that the output is auto fit for input tensor,
And my java code need allocate an enough memory.
Thanks.
